blocks.text: happening, whilst the slope curve carries us further and tells us what is likely to happen. In fact, the rate at which a quantity is changing is very often of far greater importance than the actual value of that quantity; and as illustrations of this statement the following examples present the case clearly.
The following table gives the values of the displacement of a certain battleship and the values of the offensive and defensive factors, viz. armament, armor and protection. From these figures

blocks.description: The figure shows a graph plotting values of displacement against armament for a battleship.

blocks.text: calculate values of Q (ratio of armament, etc. to displacement) and q (ratio of increase of armament, etc. with regard to displacement). Find also the values of Q′.
